trans-unit.source: Different programming model. Similar to callbacks, the programming model moves away from a top-down imperative approach to a compositional model with chained calls. Traditional program structures such as loops, exception handling, etc. usually are no longer valid in this model.
trans-unit.target: 不同的编程模式。与回调类似,编程模型也从自上而下的命令式方法转为链式调用的组成式模型。传统的程序结构如循环、异常处理等通常在这种模式下不再有效。

trans-unit.source: Difficulty of nested callbacks. Usually a function that is used as a callback, often ends up needing its own callback. This leads to a series of nested callbacks which lead to incomprehensible code. The pattern is often referred to as the titled christmas tree (brace represent branches of the tree).
trans-unit.target: 嵌套回调的难度。通常一个被用作回调的函数,最后往往需要自己的回调。这就导致了一系列的嵌套回调,从而导致了难以理解的代码。这种模式通常被称为titled christmas tree(括号代表树的分支)。

trans-unit.source: Eager type variable fixation leads to a contradictory constraint system

Earlier, Kotlin used assignments made inside a try block for smart casts after the block, which could break type- and null-safety and lead to runtime failures. This release fixes this issue, making the smart casts more strict, but breaking some code that relied on such smart casts.
trans-unit.target: 早些时候，Kotlin使用在 try 块中进行的分配来进行块之后的智能转换，这可能会破坏类型安全性和null安全性并导致运行时失败。此版本解决了此问题，使智能转换更加严格，但破坏了一些依赖于此类智能转换的代码。

trans-unit.source: Essentially, coroutines are light-weight threads. They are launched with launchcoroutine builder in a context of some CoroutineScope. Here we are launching a new coroutine in the GlobalScope, meaning that the lifetime of the new coroutine is limited only by the lifetime of the whole application.

Essentially, coroutines are light-weight threads. They are launched with launchcoroutine builder in a context of some CoroutineScope. Here we are launching a new coroutine in the GlobalScope, meaning that the lifetime of the new coroutine is limited only by the lifetime of the whole application.
trans-unit.target: 本质上，协程是轻量级的线程。它们在某些CoroutineScope的上下文中与启动的协程生成器一起启动。在这里，我们将在GlobalScope中启动一个新的协程，这意味着新协程的生命周期仅受整个应用程序生命周期的限制。

trans-unit.source: Even if you don't know Python, this document should hopefully be a useful introduction to Kotlin, in particular if you are used to other dynamically typed languages. However, if you're coming from a Java background, you're probably better off diving directly into the excellent official docs (from which this doc has drawn a lot of inspiration). To some extent, you can try to write Java code and look stuff up whenever what you're trying to do doesn't work - and some IDEs can even automatically convert Java code to Kotlin.
trans-unit.target: 即使您不了解Python，也希望该文档对Kotlin有所帮助，特别是如果您习惯于其他动态类型的语言。但是，如果您来自Java背景，那么最好直接学习出色的官方文档（该文档从中汲取了很多启发）。在某种程度上，您可以尝试编写Java代码并在您尝试执行的操作不起作用时查找内容-某些IDE甚至可以自动将Java代码转换为Kotlin。

trans-unit.source: Even if your type is not supported directly, you can write a Parceler mapping object for it.
trans-unit.target: 即使不直接支持您的类型，也可以 Parceler 编写Parceler映射对象。

trans-unit.source: Even more examples are on GitHub
Even more examples are on GitHub.
Even more specifically, if you declare a companion object inside your class, you can access its members using only the class name as a qualifier.

Even more specifically, if you declare a companion object inside your class, you'll be able to call its members with the same syntax as calling static methods in Java/C#, using only the class name as a qualifier.

trans-unit.source: Even though it is the most preferred way to provide OSGi support, unfortunately it couldn't be done for now due to so called "package split" issue that couldn't be easily eliminated and such a big change is not planned for now. There is Require-Bundle feature but it is not the best option too and not recommended to use. So it was decided to make a separate artifact for OSGi.

Ever since version 1.0, Kotlin supported expressions with complex control flow, such as try-catch expressions and inline function calls. Such code is valid according to the Java Virtual Machine specification. Unfortunately, some bytecode processing tools do not handle such code quite well when such expressions are present in the arguments of constructor calls.
trans-unit.target: 自1.0版本以来,Kotlin支持具有复杂控制流的表达式,如try-catch表达式和内联函数调用。根据Java虚拟机规范,这样的代码是有效的。不幸的是,当这种表达式出现在构造函数调用的参数中时,一些字节码处理工具并不能很好地处理这种代码。

trans-unit.source: Every Android developer knows well the findViewById() function. It is, without a doubt, a source of potential bugs and nasty code which is hard to read and support. While there are several libraries available that provide solutions to this problem, those libraries require annotating fields for each exposed View.
trans-unit.target: 每个Android开发人员都非常了解 findViewById() 函数。毫无疑问，它是潜在的错误和令人讨厌的代码的来源，很难阅读和支持。尽管有几个可用的库可为该问题提供解决方案，但这些库需要为每个公开的 View 都添加注释字段。

trans-unit.source: Every Kotlin file should belong to a package. This is somewhat similar to modules in Python, but files need to explicitly declare which package they belong to, and a package implicitly comes into existence whenever any file declares itself to belong to that package (as opposed to explicitly defining a module with __init__.py and having all the files in that directory implicitly belong to the module). The package declaration must go on the top of the file:
trans-unit.target: 每个Kotlin文件都应属于一个包。这有点类似于Python中的模块，但是文件需要显式声明它们属于哪个程序包，并且任何文件声明自己属于该程序包时，隐式地存在一个程序包（与使用 __init__.py 显式定义模块相反）。并使该目录中的所有文件隐式属于该模块）。软件包声明必须放在文件的顶部：

Examination of small programs leads to the conclusion that requiring exception specifications could both enhance developer productivity and enhance code quality, but experience with large software projects suggests a different result – decreased productivity and little or no increase in code quality.
trans-unit.target: 对小型程序的检查得出的结论是，要求使用异常规范既可以提高开发人员的生产率，又可以提高代码质量，但是大型软件项目的经验表明，结果会有所不同-生产率下降且代码质量几乎没有提高。

Extensions
Extensions and category members
Extensions are resolved statically

Extensions declared as members can be declared as open and overridden in subclasses. This means that the dispatch of such functions is virtual with regard to the dispatch receiver type, but static with regard to the extension receiver type.
trans-unit.target: 声明为成员的扩展可以在子类中声明为 open 并被重写。这意味着，对于调度接收器类型，此类功能的调度是虚拟的，而对于扩展接收器类型，则是静态的。

trans-unit.source: Extensions do not actually modify classes they extend. By defining an extension, you do not insert new members into a class, but merely make new functions callable with the dot-notation on variables of this type.
trans-unit.target: 扩展实际上并不修改它们扩展的类。通过定义扩展,你并不是在一个类中插入新的成员,而仅仅是使新的函数可以在这个类型的变量上用点符号调用。

Filtering is one of the most popular tasks in the collection processing. In Kotlin, filtering conditions are defined by predicates – lambda functions that take a collection element and return a boolean value: true means that the given element matches the predicate, false means the opposite.

Finally, the API is either removed entirely, or hidden (DeprecationLevel.HIDDEN) from code, so its usages look like unresolved references, while the API remains in the compiled code preserving binary compatibility with previously compiled code.

trans-unit.source: Finally, there are functions that simply test a predicate against collection elements:
trans-unit.target: 最后,还有一些函数只是针对集合元素测试谓词。

trans-unit.source: Finally, there is a function that lets you produce sequence elements one by one or by chunks of arbitrary sizes – the sequence() function. This function takes a lambda expression containing calls of yield() and yieldAll() functions. They return an element to the sequence consumer and suspend the execution of sequence() until the next element is requested by the consumer. yield() takes a single element as an argument; yieldAll() can take an Iterable object, an Iterator, or another Sequence. A Sequence argument of yieldAll() can be infinite. However, such a call must be the last: all subsequent calls will never be executed.
trans-unit.target: 最后，有一个函数可让您一个接一个或按任意大小的块生成序列元素-sequence sequence() 函数。此函数采用一个lambda表达式，其中包含 yield() 和 yieldAll() 函数的调用。它们将一个元素返回给序列使用者，并中止 sequence() 的执行，直到使用者请求下一个元素。 yield() 使用单个元素作为参数； yieldAll() 可以采用 Iterable 对象， Iterator 或另一个 Sequence 。甲 Sequence 的参数 yieldAll() 可以是无限的。但是，这样的调用必须是最后一个：以后的所有调用将永远不会执行。

trans-unit.source: Finally, there is a function that returns a new List containing the collection elements in a random order - shuffled(). You can call it without arguments or with a Random object.
trans-unit.target: 最后，有一个函数返回一个新的 List ,其中包含以随机顺序 shuffled() 的集合元素。您可以不带参数或使用 Random 对象来调用它。

trans-unit.source: First let's create a library. Place the tiny library source code into kotlinizer.kt:

trans-unit.source: First of all, select is biased to the first clause. When several clauses are selectable at the same time, the first one among them gets selected. Here, both channels are constantly producing strings, so a channel, being the first clause in select, wins. However, because we are using unbuffered channel, the a gets suspended from time to time on its send invocation and gives a chance for b to send, too.
trans-unit.target: 首先， select 是偏向于第一条。当同时选择多个子句时，将选择其中的第一个。在这里，两个通道都不断产生字符串，因此，作为select中的第一个子句 a 通道将获胜。但是，由于我们使用的是非缓冲通道，因此 a 的发送调用会不时暂停，也给 b 提供了发送的机会。

trans-unit.source: First of all, we need to have a native pointer to pass to the C function. We use the usePinned extension function to temporarily pin the native memory address of the byte array. The C function fills in the byte array with data. We use another extension function ByteArray.stringFromUtf8() to turn the byte array into a Kotlin String, assuming UTF-8 encoding.
trans-unit.target: 首先，我们需要一个本机指针来传递给C函数。我们使用 usePinned 扩展功能临时固定字节数组的本机内存地址。C函数用数据填充字节数组。我们使用另一个扩展函数 ByteArray.stringFromUtf8() 将字节数组转换为Kotlin String （假设采用UTF-8编码）。

trans-unit.source: First of all, we need to have a native pointer to pass to the C function. We use the usePinned extension function to temporarily pin the native memory address of the byte array. The C function fills in the byte array with data. We use another extension function ByteArray.toKString() to turn the byte array into a Kotlin String, assuming UTF-8 encoding.

trans-unit.source: First, let's think about why Java needs those mysterious wildcards. The problem is explained in Effective Java, 3rd Edition, Item 31: Use bounded wildcards to increase API flexibility. First, generic types in Java are invariant, meaning that List<String> is not a subtype of List<Object>. Why so? If List was not invariant, it would have been no better than Java's arrays, since the following code would have compiled and caused an exception at runtime:
trans-unit.target: 首先，让我们考虑一下Java为什么需要这些神秘的通配符。该问题在有效Java，第3版，第31项：使用有界通配符以增加API灵活性中进行了说明。首先，泛型类型在Java中是不变的，这意味着 List<String> 是不是一个亚型 List<Object> 。为什么这样？如果List不是不变的，那么它就不会比Java的数组好，因为以下代码将在运行时进行编译并导致异常：

First, there is natural order. It is defined for inheritors of the Comparable interface. Natural order is used for sorting them when no other order is specified.

Floating-point and other types

Floating-point numbers act similarly to in Python, but they come in two types, depending on how many digits you need. If you need larger precision, or to work with monetary amounts (or other situations where you must have exact results), use the non-primitive type BigDecimal.
trans-unit.target: 浮点数的作用与Python中的相似，但是根据所需的位数，它们分为两种类型。如果您需要更高的精度，或者需要处理货币金额（或必须具有精确结果的其他情况），请使用非原始类型 BigDecimal 。

trans-unit.source: Floats are tagged by f or F: 123.5f

Flow adheres to the general cooperative cancellation of coroutines. As usual, flow collection can be cancelled when the flow is suspended in a cancellable suspending function (like delay). The following example shows how the flow gets cancelled on a timeout when running in a withTimeoutOrNull block and stops executing its code:
Flow and Reactive Streams
Flow builders
Flow cancellation basics
Flow cancellation checks
Flow collection can complete with an exception when an emitter or code inside the operators throw an exception. There are several ways to handle these exceptions.
Flow completion
Flow context
Flow exceptions
Flows
Flows are cold streams similar to sequences — the code inside a flow builder does not run until the flow is collected. This becomes clear in the following example:
Flows are cold
Flows are sequential

Flows can be transformed with operators, just as you would with collections and sequences. Intermediate operators are applied to an upstream flow and return a downstream flow. These operators are cold, just like flows are. A call to such an operator is not a suspending function itself. It works quickly, returning the definition of a new transformed flow.

Flows must be transparent to exceptions and it is a violation of the exception transparency to emit values in the flow { ... } builder from inside of a try/catch block. This guarantees that a collector throwing an exception can always catch it using try/catch as in the previous example.

Flows represent asynchronously received sequences of values, so it is quite easy to get in a situation where each value triggers a request for another sequence of values. For example, we can have the following function that returns a flow of two strings 500 ms apart:
FocusEventInit
Fold and reduce

Following the Feedback Loop principle we release many things early for the community to try out, so a number of components are not yet released as Stable. Some of them are very early stage, some are more mature. We mark them as Experimental, Alpha or Beta depending on how quickly each component is evolving and how much risk the users are taking when adopting it.

trans-unit.source: For ThreadLocal, asContextElement extension function is here for the rescue. It creates an additional context element, which keeps the value of the given ThreadLocal and restores it every time the coroutine switches its context.
trans-unit.target: 对于 ThreadLocal ，此处提供了asContextElement扩展功能。它创建一个附加的context元素，该元素保留给定 ThreadLocal 的值，并在协程每次切换其上下文时将其恢复。

trans-unit.source: For ThreadLocal, the asContextElement extension function is here for the rescue. It creates an additional context element which keeps the value of the given ThreadLocal and restores it every time the coroutine switches its context.
For Foo<T : TUpper>, where T is an invariant type parameter with the upper bound TUpper, Foo<*> is equivalent to Foo<out TUpper> for reading values and to Foo<in Nothing> for writing values.
trans-unit.target: 对于 Foo<T : TUpper> ，其中 T 与上结合的不变型参数 TUpper ， Foo<*> 等同于 Foo<out TUpper> 用于读取值，并 Foo<in Nothing> 用于写入的值。

trans-unit.source: For Foo<in T>, where T is a contravariant type parameter, Foo<*> is equivalent to Foo<in Nothing>. It means there is nothing you can write to Foo<*> in a safe way when T is unknown.
trans-unit.target: 对于 Foo<in T> ，其中 T 是协变类型参数， Foo<*> 等效于 Foo<in Nothing> 。这意味着没有什么可以写到 Foo<*> 在一个安全的方式，当 T 是未知的。

trans-unit.source: For Foo<out T : TUpper>, where T is a covariant type parameter with the upper bound TUpper, Foo<*> is equivalent to Foo<out TUpper>. It means that when the T is unknown you can safely read values of TUpper from Foo<*>.
trans-unit.target: 对于 Foo<out T : TUpper> ，其中 T 是具有上限 TUpper 的协变类型参数， Foo<*> 等效于 Foo<out TUpper> 。这意味着当 T 未知时，您可以安全地从 Foo<*> 读取 TUpper 的值。

trans-unit.source: For scoped concurrency supervisorScope can be used instead of coroutineScope for the same purpose. It propagates cancellation only in one direction and cancels all children only if it has failed itself. It also waits for all children before completion just like coroutineScope does.
trans-unit.target: 对于有范围的并发，出于相同的目的，可以使用supervisorScope代替coroutineScope。它仅在一个方向上传播取消，并且仅在失败后才取消所有子级。就像coroutineScope一样，它也等待所有孩子完成任务。

For Kotlin types, it means that null value is allowed to be represented by this type. In practice it means that the type was declared with a question mark at the end. For non-Kotlin types, it means the type or the symbol which was declared with this type is annotated with a runtime-retained nullability annotation such as javax.annotation.Nullable.
trans-unit.target: 对于Kotlin类型，这意味着允许用该类型表示 null 值。实际上，这意味着该类型在末尾带有问号来声明。对于非Kotlin类型，这意味着使用此类型声明的类型或符号将使用运行时保留的可空性注释（例如javax.annotation.Nullable）进行注释。

For a gradual migration, it's possible to enable the "File is not formatted according to project settings" inspection. It will highlight the places that should be reformatted. After enabling the "Apply only to modified files" option, inspection will show formatting problems only in modified files. Such files are probably going to be committed soon anyway.
trans-unit.target: 对于逐步迁移，可以启用“文件未根据项目设置格式化”检查。它将突出显示应重新格式化的地方。启用“仅应用于修改后的文件”选项后，检查将仅在修改后的文件中显示格式问题。无论如何，此类文件可能很快就会提交。
